scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox  is not included in any national catalogue of recommended specifications whose Member State NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox includes references to the relevance Open Data for the development of public policies. It is one of the principles or basis for the evidence-based development that the specification defines, however, the purpose of the specification is not related to the development and publication of Linked Open Data.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html

statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox is publicly available for everyone to study with no cost.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox is a public asset developed by a European Institution and can be accessed and reused without any payment conditions. Therefore, it can be considered that the specifications is licensed under royalty-free basis and (F)RAND basis. 

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was formally defined between 2015 and 2017 with the experience and the expertise of the Member States that were closely working together to consolidate the specification. This fact demonstrates that guidelines have been agreed taking into account the experience from different stakeholders and it ensures its maturity by the time being.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox was developed between 2015 and 2017 aiming to help those involved in the creation of public policies and laws across the European Union. Its market acceptance lies in the European Public sector which has set Better regulation and the toolbox as the tools for the development, implementation and assessment of the impact of public policies and laws.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf .

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
The Better regulation toolbox is an internal European Commission resource designed as a complement to the Commission's Better regulation guideline. It provides specific and operational guidance to those involved with the various better regulation instruments. These instruments aim to give support for the implementation, monitoring, and impact assessment of public policies and laws on which new and innovative solutions should be based. Therefore, it can be considered that the Better Regulation Toolbox fosters the creation of innovative solutions and services across Europe.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf .

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox has the support of the European Commission as a developer community. It is the most powerful party giving support to its development and working to enhance through the experience.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf .

European Commission webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/index_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
One of the main goals of the Better Regulation Toolbox is to enhance the transparency of the public policy and law-making, increasing the visibility of public administrations decision-making process.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

Objective of Better Regulation Toolbox: 
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process/planning-and-proposing-law/better-regulation-why-and-how_en#objectives-of-the-better-regulation-agenda

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox is publicly available and aims to help public administrations in the development of public policies and laws according to real needs while it makes the process and data more transparent fostering the accountability of public administrations. 

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

Objective of Better Regulation Toolbox: 
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process/planning-and-proposing-law/better-regulation-why-and-how_en#objectives-of-the-better-regulation-agenda

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
The specification encompasses a set of requirements, recommendations and principles that need to be taken into account when planning, developing and also when implementing public policies. Within this set of principles defined within the different tools, the Better Regulation Process includes ICT aspects that also take into account interface issues (regarding end-user interfaces but also institutions access to interfaces).

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox is an internal European Commission resource designed as a complement to the Commission's Better regulation guideline. Even though it could be extended or modified to fit other business requirements at the National level, for instance, there are no implementations that evidence the possibility of extension to other business domains than the development of public policies and laws.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
Betterr Regulation Toolbox is publicly available for its implementation and its use for free on the European Comission's webpage.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
Betterr Regulation Toolbox can be found for free on the European Comission webpage.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
The specification is independent from any software, hardware, or operating system. It can be used and applied independently from other standards, or software requierements. 

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The Better regulation toolbox is an internal European Commission resource designed as a complement to the Commission's Better regulation guideline. It provides more specific and operational guidance to those involved with various better regulation instruments. 

The construction of European Laws and policies aims to be proportionate to users needs, rights and duties. Also, the specification sets requirements, principles and recommendations for the development of public policies and laws supporting equality and their applicability in the most broader terms.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The specification includes requirements for the alignment with relevant regulations at European level such as eIDAS, GDPR, Cybersecurity Act, etc. Ensuring that the development of policies and laws is aligned with the main legal acts, including the interoperability ones, the Better Regulation Toolbox supports the establishment of public services and tools fostering data portability.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The specification includes guidelines, recommendations and requirements with regards to the internal market (tool 24) and how policies and laws could benefit European citizens, business and institutions development reducing barriers and developing the once-only principle. 

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox includes accessibility within the ICT requirements that ICT systems and solutions should cover for the proper implementation of a specific public policy (Tool #27). Therefore, it can be considered that taking the tools and methods, the specification can positively impact the e-accessibility of public services and solutions. 

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens, businesses and public administrations by proposing methods to ensure that ICT systems and solutions developed under the scope of public services include security regarding data exchanged between parties interested. Providing this checklist method helps the development of public policies that guarantee secure and trustworthy data exchange.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The specification in its essence aims to provide tools for the construction of global, coherent and fair policies and laws. In several of the tools proposed within the specification, multilingualism is considered as part of the requirements that ICT platforms developed for public services need to comply with and ensure. Therefore, the Better Regulation Toolbox fosters the creation of policies, and laws according to reach multilingualism ensuring the equality of European citizens.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The Better regulation toolbox is an internal European Commission resource designed as a complement to the Commission's Better regulation guideline. It provides more specific and operational guidance to those involved with the various better regulation instruments. By allowing to make the data available to other persons or organisations, the Betterr Regulation Toolbox Contributes to the development of eGovernment reducing the administrative burden. 

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The specification is focused on providing guidelines, recommendations and mechanisms for the proper development of public policies and laws. Within the recommendations and mechanisms, there are no implications for long-term preservation or e-archiving. Therefore, it can be said that this is not the purpose of the specification and this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

Better Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
Several documents are stating positive feedback on the Better Regulation initiative at European Level, which include the Better Regulation Toolbox. Below there are few examples of the documentation providing insights on how important is the process, methodology and tools for the Governance of European Public Policies and laws.

Study webpage:
https://www.bruegel.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/MEMO-Better-Regulation.pdf

Study supporting the interim evaluation of the innovation principle:
https://www.ceps.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/KI0219819ENN.en_.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, the specification is associated with several ABB from the latest version published of the ELIS. More specifically,  Better Regulation Toolbox can define the interoperability aspects of the "Binding Instrument" , "Non-Binding Instrument", "Public Policy",  "Public policy cycle", and  ABBs of the EIRA Legal View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
The specification in itself acts as a method to ensure that policies and laws are developed, implemented and monitored and enhanced following a standardised method that includes, guidelines, recommendations and requirements to reach the objective of exhaustive and comprehensible laws and policies.

Better Regulation Toolbox on European Comission webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process/planning-and-proposing-law/better-regulation-why-and-how/better-regulation-guidelines-and-toolbox/better-regulation-toolbox_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
There are no Member States recommending  Better Regulation Toolbox  in their ICT National Catalogues.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
The Better Regulation Toolbox in itself is a common method for planning, developing, assessing and monitoring the implementation of policies and laws. It is used by de different EU institutions involved in these tasks, moreover, it can be transposed to national level to ensure that national laws and policies are developed with the maximum accuracy. 

Better Regulation Toolbox on European Comission webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process/planning-and-proposing-law/better-regulation-why-and-how/better-regulation-guidelines-and-toolbox/better-regulation-toolbox_en

Law-making process: 
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at the supra-national level, the European Commission has listed it within Better Regulation Toolbox with all the specifications and resources produced and used by European Institutions. 

Even though the specification is not listed in the ICT standards catalogue, it can be considered that is included within a European Catalogue because it is included within the European Commission solutions stack for the development of better digital administrations.

Better Regulation Toolbox on European Comission webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-making-process/planning-and-proposing-law/better-regulation-why-and-how/better-regulation-guidelines-and-toolbox/better-regulation-toolbox_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
The specification has been developed by European Institutions for its implementation across borders to enhance the law-making and the processes. It is involved in an organisational agreement between European Institutions "INTERINSTITUTIONAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT, THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION AND THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION ON BETTER LAW-MAKING - INTERINSTITUTIONAL AGREEMENT" that aims to enhance the law-making for efficiency and effectiveness of European processes.

European Comission Webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/index_en

INTERINSTITUTIONAL AGREEMENT:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv:OJ.L_.2016.123.01.0001.01.ENG&toc=OJ:L:2016:123:TOC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
The specification has been developed by European Institutions for its implementation across borders to improve the accountability and development of public policies and laws, the specification can be considered compliant with the different European Regulations. Moreover, one of the main goals of the specification is to foster the consistency and proper development of the general public laws and policies.

European Comission Webpage:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/index_en

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
One of the tools provided by the specification is focused on evaluating if the needs of a new proposal require any ICT aspect that can be foreseen and adapted to the most efficient manner, ensuring that the new proposal fits its needs and at the same time the process is efficient. Having said this, it is worth noting that the purpose of the specification is not related to the business process definition, and therefore, this criterion does not apply to the specification.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
Better regulation provides a set of guidelines to guarantee that policies and laws development, implementation and evaluation are properly established. At this point, the Better regulation toolbox includes a set of recommendations, best practices and requirements whose purpose is to ensure and enhance the cross-border application and organisational interoperability as much as possible.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
This document does not define a cross-sector reusable data model. The specification provides guidance and tools for the development of public policies and law taking into account a holistic perspective.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Better Regulation Toolbox includes references to the relevance of Linked Open Data for the development of public policies. It is one of the principles or basis for the evidence-based development that the specification defines, however, the purpose of the specification is not related to the development and publication of Linked Open Data.

Betterr Regulation Toolbox reference:
https://ec.europa.eu/info/sites/info/files/better-regulation-toolbox_2.pdf

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
